instructions: To send a Message with your Apple Watch, simply activate Siri with the Digital Crown (or tap the screen/raise your wrist and saying, Hey Siri ) and say Text [Contact Name]. If you have an Apple Watch with cellular, you ll be able to Message with friends whether your Apple Watch is connected to Wi-Fi or not. If you have a Wi-Fi only Apple Watch, you ll need your iPhone nearby or have your watch connected to a Wi-Fi network. Siri will ask what you want to say. Simply respond with your voice, something like Hi there, how are you? or Did you remember to pick up the milk? Siri will respond with OK, I ll send this: with the message written in a blue Messages bubble on your Apple Watch screen. Your contact will get the message unless you tap Don t Send below the proposed message.

Bring up the Apple Watch grid and tap the Message icon. You ll see a list of any previous message conversations. To start a new message, hard press the Apple Watch screen, then tap New Message . Tap Add Contact to choose who to send the message to. You can dictate it, tap the contact icon to choose from a list of all your contacts, or tap the phone dial icon to tap in a phone number. You can also scroll down using the Digital Crown to choose a frequently used contact. Next, tap Create Message . You can dictate a message, use Apple s handwriting recognition system (Scribble), or send a heart pulse or emoji. Once you ve finished your message, tap Send .

Launch the Watch app on your iPhone, then tap Messages > Default Replies . To turn the feature off, tap the toggle at the top of the list. Next, if you want to edit the Smart Replies already in the list, tap the Edit icon at the top right. Tap the reply and type your replacement message, then tap Done when finished. Tap the red circle with the dash in it to delete a reply. If you want to create a completely new reply, scroll to the bottom of the list and tap Add reply . You ll be able to then type in whatever message you want on the list, which will then be available from the Apple Watch the next time you respond to a message.
